title: Special education in jeopardy? Democrats press Trump administration
shortDescription: The probe comes as parents and disability advocates wonder whether the legal rights of students with disabilities will be protected.

title: McMorrow runs for US Senate as Michigan race gets first big name
shortDescription: Mallory McMorrow, while still a state senator, has become a national brand after a viral video rebuking GOP claims.

title: Trump's global tariffs plan rolls out today: What you can expect
shortDescription: Trump will unveil his global tariffs plan today at 4 p.m. − shortly after the recently volatile U.S. financial markets have closed for the day.

title: Ex-NFL kicker Jay Feely considering running for US Congress
shortDescription: Former NFL kicker Jay Feely is considering a run for Congress in Arizona’s 5th Congressional District.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump's long-awaited tariffs
shortDescription: The president will announce his major economic policy on Wednesday. Here's the news to know

title: Trump and his tariffs: strategy or chaos could be the next step
shortDescription: Trump has dubbed Wed, April 2, as 'Liberation Day' as he seeks to impose a slew of new tariffs. Some have questioned his tariff strategy.

title: A test for Trump as Democrats win Wisc., GOP margins sag in Fla.
shortDescription: After 72 disruptive days of President Donald Trump 2.0, some signs of caution from voters in Wisconsin and Florida special elections.

title: Liberal judge wins contentious Wisconsin court race in setback for Trump
shortDescription: The Dane County judge came out ahead, in a contest that broke records for the nation's most expensive court race.

title: Sen. Cory Booker gives record-breaking Senate speech
shortDescription: Democratic Sen. Cory Booker broke the record for longest Senate speech, breaking Sen. Strom Thurmond's 1957 speech opposing civil rights.

title: Booker's 25 hour Senate speech makes history
shortDescription: Sen. Cory Booker gave the longest Senate speech in recorded U.S. history, breaking Sen. Strom Thurmond’s 1957 record set while opposing civil rights.

title: In second victory Tuesday, Republicans hang onto Matt Gaetz's House seat
shortDescription: Republican Jimmy Patronis beat Democrat Gay Valimont. The party also held another Florida seat in Tuesday's special election.

title: Trump administration cuts FDA staff handling bird flu
shortDescription: Federal regulators were responsible for recalling pet food contaminated with bird flu, which killed household cats.

title: Booker delivers longest known Senate speech, beating Strom Thurmond
shortDescription: The Democratic senator from New Jersey began speaking at 7 p.m. Monday and continued into Tuesday evening.

title: Trump to hold meeting on potential buyers of TikTok ahead of deadline
shortDescription: President Donald Trump will meet Wednesday with top members of his administration to consider potential investors who could purchase stake in TikTok.

title: Liberal wins Wisconsin Supreme Court race; GOP holds Florida congressional seats
shortDescription: Liberal judge Susan Crawford won Wisconsin's state Supreme Court race, while Republicans held two Florida congressional seats in Tuesday's election.

title: Melania Trump honors women who have shown 'courage'
shortDescription: Since 2007, the State Department has recognized more than 200 women for "promoting peace and prosperity and human rights" countries across the world.

title: When do Trump's tariffs go into effect? President eyes expanded policies
shortDescription: Donald Trump is expected to expand his tariffs on Wednesday in a day he is dubbing 'Liberation Day.'

title: GOP, Democrats grapple over judiciary power
shortDescription: Congress held a hearing over the judiciary's role as multiple injunctions come on the heels of President Trump's executive orders.

title: President Trump decides size of tariffs, still 'perfecting' final plan
shortDescription: President Trump has made up his mind on the size of upcoming sweeping reciprocal tariffs and is "perfecting" the final details, the White House said.
